S.FORM: == Ali Bongo Ondimba == u ngangan niza u ngangan nu Hulam: 阿里·邦戈·翁丁巴 u ngangan nu Lipun: アリー・ボンゴ・オンディンバ u ngangan nu Amilika: Ali Bongo Ondimba u siwkay niza tatama, 2 a bulad 9 a demiad, Ali Bongo Ondimba, u misingkiway. 1959 a mihcan nalecuhan u tabakiay a tapang nu kanatal (congtung) nu Gabon ayza sa ci Ali Bongo Ondimba, micakat a demiad sa i 2009 a mihca 10 bulad 16 demiad. napahezek ciniza i Pali sakacacay tabakiay a cacudadan. cyama niza u Cungtung tu. 1989-1991 mamikuwan ciniza ku palcabayay a Pu Pucang. 1999-2009 mamikuwan ku palangatay a Pu Pucang. kakuniza u nasulitan nu Hulam atu Amilika Ali Bongo Ondimba is a Gabonese politician who has been President of Gabon since October 2009. Bongo is the son of Omar Bongo, who was President of Gabon from 1967 until his death in 2009. During his father's presidency, he was Minister of Foreign Affairs from 1989 to 1991 and represented Bongoville as a Deputy in the National Assembly from 1991 to 1999; subsequently he was Minister of Defense from 1999 to 2009. Following his father's death after 41 years in power, he was first elected in the August 2009 presidential election. He was re-elected in August 2016, in elections marred by numerous irregularities, arrests, human rights violations and post-election violence. Bongo is also President of the PDG.

== Ali Bongo Ondimba == o ngangan niza o ngangan no Holam: 阿里·邦戈·翁丁巴 o ngangan no Lipon: アリー・ボンゴ・オンディンバ o ngangan no Amilika: Ali Bongo Ondimba o siwkay niza tatama, 2 a bolad 9 a demiad, Ali Bongo Ondimba, o misingkiway. 1959 a mihcan nalecohan o tabakiay a tapang no kanatal (congtong) no Gabon ayza sa ci Ali Bongo Ondimba, micakat a demiad sa i 2009 a mihca 10 bolad 16 demiad. napahezek ciniza i Pali sakacacay tabakiay a cacodadan. cyama niza o Congtong to. 1989-1991 mamikowan ciniza ko palcabayay a Po Pocang. 1999-2009 mamikowan ko palangatay a Po Pocang. kakoniza o nasolitan no Holam ato Amilika Ali Bongo Ondimba is a Gabonese politician who has been President of Gabon since October 2009. Bongo is the son of Omar Bongo, who was President of Gabon from 1967 ontil his death in 2009. Doring his father's presidency, he was Minister of Foreign Affairs from 1989 to 1991 and represented Bongoville as a Depoty in the National Assembly from 1991 to 1999; sobseqoently he was Minister of Defense from 1999 to 2009. Following his father's death after 41 years in power, he was first elected in the Aogost 2009 presidential election. He was re-elected in Aogost 2016, in elections marred by nomeroos irregolarities, arrests, homan rights violations and post-election violence. Bongo is also President of the PDG.
